page.title: 17Ladybird Kennels
page.content: Mrs.Stallard has only just taken over the Ladybird Kennels, but was able to give us some information about the business. Boarding kennels have to be licensed by the Local Authority and a vet. makes an inspection twice a year. The kennels are on about 1.8 acres of land and are licensed for 50 dogs and 30 cats. Each dog has its own kennel and run and is exercised four times a day, but the cats stay in their chalets. The charges are Â£2.90 + V.A.T. per night for dogs and Â£1.95 + V.A.T. per night for cats. Business is seasonal, with their busy times being in the Summer and at Christmas when people take their holidays. Mrs.Stallard breeds and shows Great Danes. One of them is called Garth and he has to put up with a playful kitten called Kit.
